body: Perform precipitation of keyhole limpet hemocyanin \(KLH) or DNP-KLH in alum as described \(2).

Inject 100 µg of KLH or DNP-KLH precipitated in alum in a total volume of 300 µl \(volume adjusted with PBS) into the peritoneal cavity. Collect serum at d 0, d 7, and d 14 and make serial dilutions in PBS.
Coat 96-well MaxiSorp<sup>TM</sup> ELISA plates with 50 µl/well of DNP-ovalbumin \(5 µg/ml in PBS), incubate overnight at 4 ˚C \(3).
Wash with PBS + 0.05% Tween 20, block for 3 h with PBS + 2.5% bovine serum albumin. Wash 3x with PBS + 0.05% Tween 20.
Add diluted serum in triplicates, incubate overnight at 4 ˚C. Wash 3x with PBS + 0.05% Tween 20.

Add alkaline phospatase-labeled mouse IgM- and subclass IgG-specific antibodies \(working dilutions 1:250 – 1:500 in PBS + 2.5% bovine serum albumin). Incubate at 25 ˚C for 1 h. Wash 5x with PBS + 0.05% Tween 20.
Add 100 µl per well of alkaline phosphatase substrate solution. Read optical density of each well at 405 nm at 10 min and 20 min after substrate addition.
